newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Sembawang details SML offer consideration.
newsitem.headline: Sembawang details SML offer consideration.

text.p: Sembawang Corp Ltd (SembCorp) said on Thursday that, assuming full acceptances, its offer for Sembawang Maritime Ltd (SML) shares would result in payment of an aggregate consideration exceeding 20 percent of SembCorp's consolidated net asset value as at end-1995.
It said the making of the voluntary offer was therefore subject to shareholders approval unless a waiver from the Stock Exchange of Singapore were obtained.

Earlier on Thursday a statement from Standard Chartered Merchant Bank Asia Ltd, acting for SembCorp, said it was proposing to make a voluntary takeover offer for all SML shares at Singapore $3.70 a share and all outstanding SML convertible unsecured loan stock (CULS) at S$1.23 each.
As at August 22, SembCorp owns 33.1 million SML shares or about 33.2 percent of the company and S$24.8 million principal amount of CULS which may be converted into 8.3 million new SML shares.
